title: Linux Profile and Hang issues
content: I am a long time Thunderbird user on both Windows and now on Linux. My current Linux Mint system and Thunderbird are both current on updates. Thunderbird has been experiencing hang for several weeks (maybe more like a couple months) I have been living with it as it will recover if I wait a minute or so. Today when I started looking the issue I was more than a little disturbed to find the profile being used was located in mt home folder instead of on the server I had been using it on (I thought) for several years. Upon further examination it appears I have FOUR profile showing up and the one on the server has not been used in over a year. Why would my default profile not be where I expect it to be living??? I guessing I have a bunch personal folders data now scattered out across in at least three places and only one of them is getting backed up. NOT a very happy camper here today. . . See attached info: I didn't see anything in the log file, but then the hangs seem to recover when I wait them out.
creator: davedrumm41

title: Double-clicking attachments saves them to temp folder, not attachments folder
content:
I'm having the same problem referenced in this question:

[saving to private folder in Thunderbird 91.4.1]

When I double-click an attachment like a PDF, it saves into an obscure temporary folder (for example, " /private/var/folders/03/11rmmn856ndc6p50q_ffc4xm0000gn/T/pid-20977 ") rather than to the folder I've designated for saving my attachments. I want those files to save to the folder with the rest of my attachments, so I have them for non-Thunderbird reference and access. How do I get TB to actually save the files there on double-click?
creator: mattholm

title: Thunderbird 115.6.1 won't let me add a Microsoft Office 365 e-mail account.
content: The account works in Outlook and can be accessed via the Web portal but after attempting to setup the account, everything looks good until I hit Done then an error message comes up saying "Unable to log in at server. Probably wrong configuration, username or password." What is going on here. I've been able to use the same configuration in Outlook and two iOS applications.
creator: skip18

title: Thunderbird versions need to show which addons are available!
content: I have been trying to update Thunderbird from V52 for a long time., Last time I tried, the add-ons I need were randomly only available for different versions, and hardly any of them were available for the latest version. After several days trawling through finding replacement add-ons trawling through hundreds of 20 per page lists and checking each add-on's versions history for compatibility , I gave up. Is there a simpler way to do this? There used to be pages of add ons for each version, no link for that anymore that I can see. Thunderbird would be a lot more popular if updates listed addons they made incompatible. Any ideas anyone?
creator: firefox.com1
